required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Study of Moisture Sensor Dressing Used for Exuding Wounds
clinical_study.official_title: Post Market Clinical Follow-up (PMCF) Study for DryMax Sensor

collaborator.agency: Primary Health Care Center, Department of Health Medicine and Caring Sciences, Linköping University, Linköping, Sweden

brief_summary.textblock: Observational prospective study of the clinical use of a wound dressing with a moisture sensor for use on exuding wounds.

detailed_description.textblock:
The PMCF study will be performed as a prospective and open study of a wound dressing with a moisture sensor on exuding wounds.
Using DryMax Sensor and the display indication - advisory only - might influence the clinician's workflow and the patient's engagement in their care. The PMCF study aims to study the use of the sensor in the clinical procedure of dressing changes in one or more healthcare settings. To study how the new product is received, and how it is used in the workflow, related to its clinical performance.
Furthermore, the aim is to gather safety-related clinical data for common harms within exudate management.

primary_outcome.measure: Questionnaire regarding workflow of the clinical procedure for dressing change
primary_outcome.description: Yes/no questions and questions with multiple choices

primary_outcome.measure: Questionnaire regarding the satisfaction using the device
primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, up to 4 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Weight of dressing after use using a balance
Registration of time for display activation
secondary_outcome.description: Time for display activation - hours since application [h]

secondary_outcome.measure: Questionnaire regarding leakage, strike-through, exudate viscosity
secondary_outcome.description: Yes/no questions and questions with multiple choices

secondary_outcome.measure: Measurement of wound size with a ruler

intervention.description: Clinical procedure for change of wound dressing

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- male or female, ≥18 years
- presence of an exuding wound, according to the clinician's assessment
- the wound is deemed suitable for treatment with DryMax Sensor
- an appropriate dressing size is available to be used according to the size of the wound
- the participant has given a written informed consent to participate in the study.
Exclusion Criteria:
- known pregnancy at the inclusion visit
- known or suspected hypersensitivity to the DryMax Sensor or its components
- mental inability, reluctance or language difficulties that cause difficulties in understanding the meaning of participating in the study
- ongoing treatment with systemic antibiotics
- illness or treatment of an indication other than the wound and which, according to the study personnel, can affect the wound treatment, the study, and/or the dressing.

facility.name: Primary Health Care Center in Österlötland

patient_data.ipd_description: Data will be analyzed and published on a group level.
